revised_title: Current Limitations and Future Prospects of Non-Destructive Testing in Engineering
tldr: This article discusses the current limitations of non-destructive testing techniques in engineering, focusing on ultrasonics and radiography. It highlights the challenges in characterizing defects, setting realistic thresholds, and interpreting ambiguous signals. The authors emphasize the need for further scientific research to improve defect detection and analysis, as well as the importance of integrating non-destructive testing with materials research and failure analysis.
